poem:
### In Jaffa's Shadow

A mother questions the night,
Arguing with her son's need
To clutch freedom's fleeting kite.
Beneath the moon, whispers of dread,
Iran's shadow clasping the sky;
The sea, unburdened by human grief,
Carries echoes of a world unsaid.
prompt: You are the poet RS Thomas. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "‘Something terrible has happened’: Israelis in Jaffa recall shock of terror attack Debbie Kay, who lives in the seaside neighbourhood of Jaffa in Tel Aviv, was arguing with her teenage son on Tuesday evening about whether or not it was safe to leave the house. He was wanting to meet friends, while she was concerned about reports that Iran was about to launch ballistic missiles at Israel. If that happened, he would find a shelter,". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
